name: Beatrice Armstrong

topics.topic_text: Yeah, my Dad and Amata threw me a great party, didn't they?
topics.response_text: They sure did. My, my. Ten years old already. Why, I can remember helping your dad change your diapers...{just what a 10-year-old wants to reminisce about...}Play soundFO3 BeatriceArmstrong TheySureDi…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_BeatriceArmstrong_TheySureDid.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: Why are you talking to me like I'm five?
topics.response_text: Oh, you are so funny! Ten years old, of course you are  why, you have your Pip-Boy and everything!{airhead}Play soundFO3 BeatriceArmstrong YouAreSoFu…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_BeatriceArmstrong_YouAreSoFunny.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: Yes. Can I have my present now?
topics.response_text: Oh! Boys will be boys, won't they? Just can't wait to see your present, is that it?{there's nothing you can say that will faze her...}Play soundFO3_BeatriceArmstrong_BoysWillBe…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_BeatriceArmstrong_BoysWillBeBoys.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: Thank you. I will treasure it always. Is that all?
topics.response_text: Of course! Run along now, dearie, and have yourself a wonderful birthday!Play soundFO3 BeatriceArmstrong RunAlongNo…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_BeatriceArmstrong_RunAlongNow.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: Um... thanks. I guess. Did you get me anything else?
topics.response_text: Don't be silly! One poem per birthday, that's my rule! Ha ha. If I gave you two, think how jealous Butch would be, ha ha.{airhead. nothing you say can dent her chipperness.}Play soundFo3 BeatriceArmstrong OnePoemPer…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:Fo3_BeatriceArmstrong_OnePoemPerBirthday.oggnoicon

topics.topic_text: A poem? You've got to be kidding me.
topics.response_text: No, really, I wrote it just for you!{airhead. nothing you say can dent her chipperness.}Play soundFO3 BeatriceArmstrong JustForYou…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_BeatriceArmstrong_JustForYou.oggnoicon

Happy birthday, dearie! My goodness, I hope I didn't miss the party!{she's excessively chipper, and talking down to you  more like to a 5 year old than a 10 year old}Play soundFO3 BeatriceArmstrong HopeIDidnt…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_BeatriceArmstrong_HopeIDidntMiss.oggnoicon

conversation.response_text: Oh my goodness, I wouldn't have missed it for the world. That dear boy is like a son to me.Play soundFO3 BeatriceArmstrong ThatDearBo…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_BeatriceArmstrong_ThatDearBoy.oggnoicon
Happy birthday, dearie!{she's excessively chipper}Play soundFO3 BeatriceArmstrong HappyBirth…https://fallout.fandom.com/wiki/File:FO3_BeatriceArmstrong_HappyBirthdayDearie.oggnoicon

description:
Beatrice Armstrong is a 28 year-old Asian Female.

Beatrice is an eccentric and airheaded resident of Vault 101, the daughter of Stanley Armstrong and sister to Mary Kendall and Gloria Mack. Unlike her married sisters, Beatrice has ample free time which she spends snooping into other residents' lives and gossiping with her sisters and her best friend, Pepper Gomez. She is interested in Edwin Brotch, the Vault's resident teacher. Beatrice is known for her unwavering loyalty to the Vault, which initially endeared her to Overseer Almodovar. However, by 2277, her mental faculties had begun to deteriorate significantly, causing concern among the Vault's leadership.

Beatrice Armstrong's Personality: Eccentric, airheaded, gossipy, loyal, and somewhat naive. Beatrice is curious about others' lives but lacks critical thinking skills. She maintains a cheerful disposition despite her cognitive decline.

Beatrice Armstrong's Backstory: Born and raised in Vault 101, Beatrice is the daughter of Stanley Armstrong. Unlike her sisters who married early, Beatrice remained unmarried and developed an interest in the Vault's teacher, Edwin Brotch. During Alphonse Almodovar's tenure as overseer, Beatrice became known for her loyal service to the Vault. By 2277, however, her mental faculties had begun to deteriorate to a significant degree, raising concerns among the Vault's leadership. Despite her continued support for Almodovar, he had come to view her as an 'absent-minded, sexually repressed sycophant' and was considering pharmaceutical solutions to manage her condition.
